author: etan_status
content: The CL would need to compute the keccak transaction hashes to serve proofs. It would also need to create a transaction index to know what block contains them. And it would restrict split block storage designs where the CL tosses the transactions data.

author: etan_status
content:
The `transactions_root` inside the `ExecutionPayloadHeader` is an SSZ root that the EL knows nothing about. 
The `transactions_root` inside the EL block header (the one you see in the networks providing EL data, I guess Portal as well) is a hexary root.
So, for transactions / withdrawals proofs, you will need to obtain the EL block header as well (unless you want an SSZ proof, but not sure who provides them).
